text: Young Marine Otters remain with their parents for approximately ten months .Adults transport their young by carrying them in their mouths or resting the young on their bellies as they swim on their backs .Both adults in the monogamous pair bring prey back to the den to feed their young ( Parera 1996 ) .

text: It is listed in Appendix I of CITES ( Nowak 1991 ) and in Appendix I of the Bonn Convention ( Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals ( CMS ) ) .Pomatoschistus minutus is a very abundant fish which is present along all British and Irish coasts .

text: The Marine Otter has a restricted distribution along the Pacific coast from northern Peru along the Chilean coast to Cape Horn and Isla de Los Estados in Argentina .It is patchily distributed from Peru to Tierra del Fuego .Its distribution north of 39 ° S latitude is becoming highly fragmented because of exploitation , pollution and increased human occupation along the seashores .
label: Background

text: The large - scale concentrations and long - term trends in OH can be inferred indirectly using global measurements of trace gases for which emissions are well known and the primary sink is OH .The best trace gas used to date for this purpose is methyl chloroform ; long - term measurements of this gas are reviewed in Section 2.3.4 .
label: Background

text: Marine Otters may compete with gulls ( Larus ) and the South American Sea Lion ( Otaria flavescens ) for similar species of prey fish ( Cabello 1978 ) .The most important natural predator of the Marine Otter is the Killer Whale ( Orcinus orca ; Cabello 1978 ) , but adults also may be killed by sharks ( Parera 1996 ) and birds of prey may capture juveniles when on land ( Cabello 1983 ) .
label: Background

text: The sand goby is considered to be an abundant species , found along all coasts of the British Isles .It can tolerate a wide range of temperatures and salinities , shown by its distribution from Norway and the Baltic Sea to the Mediterranean , and the fact that it resides in brackish and fully saline waters .
label: Background
